What happens to fees generated from cross-chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool on a new blockchain?

Fees generated from cross-chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool on a new blockchain are earned on that new blockchain, with no rent or fees going back to the Verus blockchain. This allows for seamless connectivity between the two blockchains.

## Blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches with minimum participation or automatic refunds, including for dual launches (blockchain and bridge)
- Set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in your preferred currencies on chain. If by the start time of your blockchain, minimums are not met, all participants will automatically get a refund of all of their pre-conversions, less the network fees. The launch options also provide for maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price neutral pre-allocations to select IDs that increase the fractional reserve ratio to issue currencies, similarly price neutral carve-outs of proceeds, and pre-launch discounts for early participants. Using VerusIDs, launches can also include vesting schedules in the pre-allocations as well.

- The Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network allows the creation of an unlimited number of interoperable blockchains in the Verus network. There is no limit on the number of blockchains that may continuously operate and interoperate on the Verus network. How do blockchain-based crowdfunding currency launches work on Verus?

On Verus, blockchain-based crowdfunding currency launches can be set up with a required minimum level of worldwide participation in preferred currencies. If the minimum participation levels are not met by the start time of the blockchain, all participants will automatically receive a refund of their pre-conversions, minus network fees. The launch options also allow for maximum participation, pre-launch discounts, price-neutral pre-allocations, and vesting schedules.

What is the Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network, and what are its key features?

The Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network is a system that allows for the creation of an unlimited number of interoperable blockchains. It enables decentralized bridge confirmation through Notary IDs, making public blockchains available for merge mining and staking, as well as private internal blockchains. The network allows for easy setup and bridging of public currencies into an organization's internal private network, with all features and currencies of the public chain but without external access. There is no limit to the number of blockchains that can operate and interoperate on the Verus network.

What is the role of Notary IDs in the Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network?

Notary IDs, specified at chain definition, provide decentralized blockchain-specific bridge confirmation in the Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network. This enables public blockchains to be available for merge mining and staking, as well as private internal blockchains, and allows for easy bridging of public currencies into an organization's internal private network.
